Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Closed-Loop Vasopressor Control in Post-Cardiac Surgery Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 40 patients admitted to the ICU after cardiac surgery were randomised into two groups.

Participants.evidence: 40 patients admitted to the ICU after cardiac surgery

Intervention.evidence: The CLV group received norepinephrine infusion controlled by the CLV system, while the control group had manual adjustments by ICU nurses.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated whether CLV management reduces hypotension compared to standard care in postcardiac surgery patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the percentage of time with hypotension (MAP <65 mm Hg) over a 2-hour period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 40 patients admitted to the ICU after cardiac surgery were randomised into two groups.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The CLV group experienced significantly less hypotension (1.4% [0.9–2.3]) compared to the control group (12.5% [9.9–24.3]; location difference, −9.8% [95% CI, −5.4 to −15.9]; P < .001).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
